sense.name: an observable, distinguishing characteristic
sense.examples: He was a letter-of-the-law man, a common trait in coaches. A very dry wit is one of the author's most notable traits.

sense.name: a genetically determined characteristic
sense.examples: Eye color is an inheritable trait. This trait is recessive, and does not appear in most of the offspring.

sense.name: a stroke with pencil or pen
sense.commentary: TRAIT[+entity][+form][+stroke][+pencil] Note: probably a rare usage
sense.examples: Mary admired the delicate traits of the artist's pencil portraits.
